These are the top 7 tips for how to navi: These are the top 7 tips for how to navigate the internet safely and securely!
You never know who you're truly speaking: You never know who you're truly speaking to online, so never share your personal information! Giving away your personal info - real name, address, phone numbers, photos or school - could lead to you being scammed, bullied or put in serious danger.
Never share your any of your personal de: Never share your any of your personal details. This includes Facebook, Instagram, etc. You never know who might get their hands on it!
Don't Give In To Peer Pressure: Don't Give In To Peer Pressure
Just because everyone else seems to be d: Just because everyone else seems to be doing it, doesn't mean you have to. If you are not comfortable with something, don't do it!
Do not meet up with someone you only kno: Do not meet up with someone you only know from the internet! People aren't always who they claim to be. If a Habbo asks you to meet with them in real life say "No, thanks!" click 'Ignore' on them and tell your parents or another trusted adult.
Don't Be Scared To Speak Up: Don't Be Scared To Speak Up
If someone is making you feel uncomforta: If someone is making you feel uncomfortable, threatening you, or pressuring you to do something you don't want to, put them on ignore, and report them immediately to our moderation team.
You have no control over your personal p: You have no control over your personal photos, videos + webcam images after you share them on the internet. Once an image is posted, it can never be removed, will be viewable by anyone and could be used to bully or blackmail you. Before you share a pic or video, ask yourself; are you comfortable with people you don't know viewing it?
Websites that offer free prizes, credits: Websites that offer free prizes, credits, furni, or "staff rights" are ALL scams designed to steal your password. Never give them your login details or download files from these websites. They could be keyloggers or viruses!

You need to enable two-factor authentica: Sie müssen die Zwei-Faktor-Authentifizierung aktivieren, um auf diese Seite zugreifen zu können.
Disabling two-factor authentication remo: Wenn Sie die Zwei-Faktor-Authentifizierung deaktivieren, wird eine zusätzliche Sicherheitsmaßnahme entfernt, was das Risiko eines unbefugten Zugriffs auf Ihr Konto erhöhen kann.
Enabling two-factor authentication adds: Durch Aktivieren der Zwei-Faktor-Authentifizierung wird eine zusätzliche Sicherheitsebene hinzugefügt, die Ihr Konto vor unbefugtem Zugriff schützt.
We recommend that you use this security: Wir empfehlen Ihnen, diese Sicherheitsfunktion zu verwenden, um Ihr Konto vor jeglicher Art von Bedrohung zu schützen!
Store these recovery codes in a secure p: Speichern Sie diese Wiederherstellungscodes in einem sicheren Passwort-Manager. Sie können verwendet werden, um den Zugriff auf Ihr Konto wiederherzustellen, wenn Sie Ihr Zwei-Faktor-Authentifizierungsgerät verlieren.
